page.title: 14Silver Jubilee in Highworth.
page.content: Many people remember the Queens' Silver Jubilee on the 7th of June 1977. In Highworth there were stalls selling souviners and all the children under 12 got Jubilee mugs at half price. In the afternoon there were some games for the children like football,running and fancy dress competitions. They also had tea and cakes. In the evening the old people danced to the music of the Highworth Silver Band.There was a parade of floats going round Highworth. Each float represented a year of the Queens reign. There were decorations all round Highworth,there were street parties everywhere.It was a thoroughly memorable day.Because of it the High Street was closed down and the traffic came to a standstill for a time.
